content.description:
Figure 1. Effect of light intensity (<math alttext="micromoles per square meter per second" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mtext>μmol·m</mtext><mtext>-2</mtext></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mtext>-1</mtext></msup></math>) on the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a solution containing algae
Students investigated the effect of light intensity on the rates of photosynthesis and cellular respiration in algae. They placed equal numbers of algal cells into test tubes containing a solution at <math alttext="p H 7.40" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>pH</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7.40</mn></math>. The test tubes were divided into four treatment groups, and each treatment group was exposed to a different light intensity. The <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the tubes was measured every <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and used as an indicator of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration because <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> produces an acidic solution when dissolved in water (Figure 1).
content.question:
Scientists claim that changes in the rate of photosynthesis will be reflected by changes in <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Which of the following best supports their claim?

choices.label: Algae performing photosynthesis remove <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the solution, increasing <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Algae performing photosynthesis release <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> into the solution, decreasing <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Algae performing photosynthesis remove <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the solution, decreasing <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Algae performing photosynthesis release <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> into the solution, increasing <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Algae performing photosynthesis remove <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the solution, increasing <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
